intro: Hepatica triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed liverwort, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves that often have three lobes. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically blue or white, appearing in early spring. Hepatica triloba thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky areas. Its unique morphology and early blooming habit make it a notable species in botanical studies.
